tit.cmt: タイトルなので、theを除きました。

sen.j: 紀州徳川家（きしゅうとくがわけ）は、江戸時代に紀伊国・伊勢国を治めた徳川氏の一支系で、徳川御三家のひとつ。
sen.e: The Kishu Tokugawa family governed the Kii Province and the Ise province during the Edo period; the Kishu Tokugawa family was one of the subsidiary lines of the Tokugawa clan and was one of the Tokugawa gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family).

The Kishu Tokugawa family was one of branches of the Tokugawa family and one of Tokugawa Gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family), which governed Kii Province and Ise province during the Edo period

The Kishu Tokugawa family was one of branches of the Tokugawa family and one of Tokugawa Gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family), which governed Kii Province and Ise province during the Edo period

sen.j: 紀伊徳川家とも称され、単に紀州家、紀伊家ともいう。
sen.e: The Kishu Tokugawa family was also referred to as the Kii Tokugawa family but simply refereed to as the Kishu and the Kii family.
It is also referred to as the Kii Tokugawa family, or as the Kishu family or the Kii family in its simple form.
It is also referred to as the Kii Tokugawa family, or as the Kishu family or the Kii family in its simple form.

sen.j: また初代頼宣が常陸国に封じられ常陸介にも叙任された。
sen.e: Additionally, the Edo Bakufu administrator confined Yorinobu, the first family head, to Hitachi province while also giving him investiture, making him a Hitachi no suke (assistant director of Hitach province).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The first family head, Yorinobu, was given a fief in Hitachi Province and appointed as Hitachi no Suke (the vice-governor of Hitach Province) to become a kunimochidaimyo (a daimyo [Japanese feudal lord] with a vast fiefdom).
sen.cmt: 分かりづらい表現、日本語解釈ミスがあるため直しました。本文と次の文をまとめて一文としました。
sen.e: The first family head, Yorinobu, was given a fief in Hitachi Province and appointed as Hitachi no Suke (the vice-governor of Hitach Province) to become a kunimochidaimyo (a daimyo [Japanese feudal lord] with a vast fiefdom).

sen.j: そして、国持大名になった。
sen.e: Subsequently, Yorinobu would become a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) with a governing province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Subsequently, Yorinobu would become a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) with a governing province.
Subsequently, Yorinobu would become a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) with a governing province.

sen.j: その故事にちなみ、紀伊国へ移封されたのちも頼宣の子孫は代々常陸介に叙任された。
sen.e: Because of this historical fact, following the Edo Bakufu administrator's forced relocation of Yorinobu to the Kii Province, the Edo Bakufu administrator supplied the investiture enabling them to become Hitachi no suke (assistant director of Hitach province).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Because of this, successors of Yorinobu were appointed Hitachi no Suke for generations although his fief was later moved to Kii Province.
sen.cmt: 分かりづらい表現、日本語解釈ミスがあるため直しました。
sen.e: Because of this, successors of Yorinobu were appointed Hitachi no Suke for generations although his fief was later moved to Kii Province.

sen.j: このため徳川常陸介家と呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: Therefore, the Kishu Tokugawa family is sometimes referred to as the Tokugawa Hitachi no suke.
Therefore, the Kishu Tokugawa family is also referred to as the Tokugawa Hitachi no Suke family in some cases.
sen.cmt: 語抜けがあったので補いました。
sen.e: Therefore, the Kishu Tokugawa family is also referred to as the Tokugawa Hitachi no Suke family in some cases.

sen.j: 徳川家康の十男徳川頼宣を家祖とし、江戸時代を通じて紀州藩の藩主であった。
sen.e: Yorinobu TOKUGAWA, the tenth son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, founded the Kishu Tokugawa family and the Kishu Tokugawa family was the lords over the Kishu Domain, throughout the Edo period.
The Kishu Tokugawa family was founded by Yorinobu TOKUGAWA, the tenth son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and its family heads governed Kishu Domain throughout the Edo period.
The Kishu Tokugawa family was founded by Yorinobu TOKUGAWA, the tenth son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and its family heads governed Kishu Domain throughout the Edo period.

sen.j: 第5代藩主吉宗と第13代藩主慶福が、それぞれ第8代征夷大将軍徳川吉宗、第14代将軍徳川家茂となっている。
sen.e: Yoshimune, the fifth lord of the Kishu Domain, and Yoshitomi, the thirteenth lord of Kishu Domain, each would become Shogun; Yoshimune became the eighth Seitaishogun (commander in chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians; a great and unifying leader), Yoshimune Tokugawa; then, Yoshitomi became the fourteenth Shogun, Iemochi TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Its fifth lord Yoshimune and thirteenth lord Yoshitomi became the eighth Seiitaishogun (the formal title name of the Shogun, which originally means the commander in chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians), Yoshimune TOKUGAWA, and the fourteenth Seiitaishogun, Iemochi TOKUGAWA, respectively.

Its fifth lord Yoshimune and thirteenth lord Yoshitomi became the eighth Seiitaishogun (the formal title name of the Shogun, which originally means the commander in chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians), Yoshimune TOKUGAWA, and the fourteenth Seiitaishogun, Iemochi TOKUGAWA, respectively.

sen.j: 徳川御三家のうちで征夷大将軍を輩出した唯一の家である。
sen.e: The Kishu Tokugawa family was the only family to produce a Seitaishogun, from among the Tokugawa gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family) families.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is the only the family which had produced a Seitaishogun among Tokugawa Gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family).
sen.cmt: 文法の誤りを訂正しました。
sen.e: It is the only the family which had produced a Seitaishogun among Tokugawa Gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family).

sen.j: 紀州家の支系（御連枝）は、伊予国西条藩の西条松平家のみである。
sen.e: The subsidiary lines of the families (Gorenshi [an honorific naming for a brother of a prestigious nobleman]) of the Kishu was only one, the Saijo Matsudaira Family of the Saijo Domain in Iyo Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Its subsidiary line (referred as "Gorenshi") was solely the Saijo Matsudaira Family of Saijo Domain in Iyo Province.
Its subsidiary line (referred as "Gorenshi") was solely the Saijo Matsudaira Family of Saijo Domain in Iyo Province.

sen.j: しかし、吉宗が徳川将軍家の後嗣に入り新たに御三卿（田安徳川家と一橋徳川家、のちに清水徳川家が加わる。）を創始した。
sen.e: However, Yoshimune became the successor of the Tokugawa Shogun family and newly founded gosankyo (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family [the Tayasu Tokugawa Family and the Hitotsubashi Tokugawa family; later Shimizu Tokugawa family joined.]) families.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, after Yoshimune succeeded to the Tokugawa Shogun family, he founded Gosankyo (Three Lord: three junior collateral houses of the Tokugawa family) (originally the Tayasu Tokugawa family and the Hitotsubashi Tokugawa family; later the Shimizu Tokugawa family was added); as a result, the lineage of the Kishu family greatly prospered.
sen.cmt: 簡潔にしました。御三卿の定義を変えました。本文と次の文をまとめて一文としました。
sen.e: However, after Yoshimune succeeded to the Tokugawa Shogun family, he founded Gosankyo (Three Lord: three junior collateral houses of the Tokugawa family) (originally the Tayasu Tokugawa family and the Hitotsubashi Tokugawa family; later the Shimizu Tokugawa family was added); as a result, the lineage of the Kishu family greatly prospered.

sen.j: そのことによって紀州家の血筋は大いに繁栄した。
sen.e: The result of this was in the lineage of the families of Kishu gaining great prosperity.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The result of this was in the lineage of the families of Kishu gaining great prosperity.
The result of this was in the lineage of the families of Kishu gaining great prosperity.

sen.j: 将軍家・御三卿からさらに大名家に養子に出た者も非常に多い。
sen.e: Remarkably, many numbers of the Kishu family entered as an adopted child, such as a Shogun family, a gosankyo family, and a daimyo family.
Many sons born in the Kishu family were offered for adoption to other daimyo families as well as the Shogun family, or the Gosankyo families.
sen.cmt: 分かりやすくするため表現を変えました。
sen.e: Many sons born in the Kishu family were offered for adoption to other daimyo families as well as the Shogun family, or the Gosankyo families.

sen.j: 明治維新後は華族に列し、侯爵を授けられた。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, the Kishu family lined up with the kazoku (noble) family, receiving the title of marquis.
After the Meiji Restoration, the Kishu family was ranked among kazoku (the noblity) and received the title of Marquis.
After the Meiji Restoration, the Kishu family was ranked among kazoku (the noblity) and received the title of Marquis.

sen.j: 戦前の紀州家は、日本でも屈指の富豪といわれ、戦後も第16代当主徳川頼貞は参議院に2期連続当選を果たすなど存在感を示した。
sen.e: Before the war, the Kishu family was one of the best families with the greatest wealth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The pre-war Kishu family was reputed to be one of the wealthiest families in Japan, and it still remained active after the war; for instance, the 16th family head Yorisada TOKUGAWA was elected to the House of Councilors for two consecutive terms.
sen.cmt: 分かりづらい表現を直し、簡潔にしました。文の流れを良くする為、原文通り本文と次の文をまとめて一文としました。
sen.e: The pre-war Kishu family was reputed to be one of the wealthiest families in Japan, and it still remained active after the war; for instance, the 16th family head Yorisada TOKUGAWA was elected to the House of Councilors for two consecutive terms.

sen.j: しかし、頼貞の生前の散財に加え、頼貞が1954年に没した後に借金返済のために遺族が興した事業は次々と失敗に終わり、更に家庭内のスキャンダルも重なったため、戦後はマスコミの格好の餌食となった。
sen.e: However, Yorisada spent extravagantly from the Kishu family funds during his life time; he died in 1954.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, not only did the family suffer Yorisada's squandering during his lifetime, but also the businesses it had launched after his death in 1954 to pay off the debt made by him failed one after another, and furthermore, a scandal took place in the family; thus, during the post-war period, the Kishu family fell victim to the burning curiosity of the mass media.
sen.cmt: 過剰な訳出部を除き、簡潔にしました。文の流れを良くする為、原文通り本文と以下３文をまとめました。
sen.e: However, not only did the family suffer Yorisada's squandering during his lifetime, but also the businesses it had launched after his death in 1954 to pay off the debt made by him failed one after another, and furthermore, a scandal took place in the family; thus, during the post-war period, the Kishu family fell victim to the burning curiosity of the mass media.

sen.j: なお、頼貞の嫡子である徳川頼韶が1958年に42歳の若さで亡くなり、それ以降は、家の名は頼貞の夫人や娘の女系によって名目上は保たれていた。
sen.e: Additionally, Yoriaki TOKUGAWA, a legitimate child of Yorisada, died young in 1985; he was just forty-two years old at the time of his death.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Yoriaki TOKUGAWA, an heir of Yorisada, died young at the age of 42 in 1985, and after that the family name was kept by the female family members, namely Yorisada's wife and daughter, in name.
sen.cmt: 文法の誤りを直し、表現を簡潔にしました。原文に近くするため、本文と次の文をまとめて一文としました。
sen.e: Yoriaki TOKUGAWA, an heir of Yorisada, died young at the age of 42 in 1985, and after that the family name was kept by the female family members, namely Yorisada's wife and daughter, in name.

sen.j: しかし、旧侯爵家としては事実上の断絶状態にあるとする記述も見受けられ、またいわゆる松平氏の子孫で構成される徳川・松平一門の会にも、現19代当主は会員と認められていないとの説もある。
sen.e: However, some Japanese media stated in several articles that as a former marquis family the Kishu family was in reality an extinction condition.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, it is mentioned in some cases that the Kishu Marquis family in reality became extinct, and also there exists a view that the 19th family head has not been recognized as a member of the Tokugawa and Matsudaira family association, which was formed by descendents of the Matsudaira clan.
sen.cmt: 過剰な訳出部を除き、表現を簡潔にしました。原文に近くするため、本文と次の文をまとめて一文としました。
sen.e: However, it is mentioned in some cases that the Kishu Marquis family in reality became extinct, and also there exists a view that the 19th family head has not been recognized as a member of the Tokugawa and Matsudaira family association, which was formed by descendents of the Matsudaira clan.

tit.e: The successive family heads and their successors
Successive family heads and their offspring
tit.cmt: theを除き、語を変えました。
tit.e: Successive family heads and their offspring

The first (the lord of the domain): Yorinobu TOKUGAWA

sen.e: Yorizumi MATSUDAIRA (The first lord of the Saijo Domain in Iyo Province)

sen.j: 松平頼職（越前国丹生藩主、のち紀州藩四代藩主徳川頼職）
sen.e: Yorimoto MATSUDAIRA (He was a lord of the Nyu Domain in the Echizen Province, later he would become the fourth lord of the Kishu Domain, Yorimoto TOKUGAWA.)
Yorimoto MATSUDAIRA (the lord of Nyu Domain in Echizen Province; later the fourth lord of Kishu Domain, Yorimoto TOKUGAWA)

sen.j: 松平頼方（越前国葛野藩主、のち紀州藩五代藩主・八代将軍徳川吉宗）
sen.e: Yorikata MATSUDAIRA (He was a lord of the Kazurano Domain in the Echizen Province, later he would become the fifth lord of the Kishu Domain and then the eighth Shogun, Yoshimune TOKUGAWA.)

sen.j: 1716年、八代将軍徳川吉宗として徳川将軍家へ養子。
sen.e: In 1716, Yoshimune entered the Tokugawa Shogun family as an adopted child and would become the eighth Shogun, Yoshimune TOKUGAWA.
In 1716, he was adopted into the Tokugawa Shogun family to become the eighth Shogun, Yoshimune TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 文法の誤りを直し、表現を簡潔にしました。

sen.e: The sixth (the lord of the Domain): Munenao TOKUGAWA (He was an adopted child from the Saijo Domain, a branch domain of the Kishu Domain; he was a cousin of Yoshimune.)

sen.e: The thirteenth (the lord of the Domain): Iemochi TOKUGAWA
The thirteenth (the lord of the domain): Iemochi TOKUGAWA

sen.j: 1858年、十四代将軍徳川家茂として将軍家へ養子。
sen.e: In 1858, Iemochi entered the Tokugawa Shogun family as an adopted child and would eventually become the fourteenth Shogun, Iemochi TOKUGAWA.
In 1858, he was adopted into the Tokugawa Shogun family to become the fourteenth Shogun Iemochi TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 文法の誤りを直し、簡潔にしました。
sen.e: In 1858, he was adopted into the Tokugawa Shogun family to become the fourteenth Shogun Iemochi TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 十四代（藩主） 徳川茂承（支藩西条藩から養子、紀州藩七代藩主徳川宗将の玄孫。）
sen.e: The fourteenth (the lord of the Domain): Mochitsugu TOKUGAWA (He was an adopted child from the Saijo Domain, a branch domain of the Kishu Domain; he was a great-great-grandson of Munenobu TOKUGAWA, the seventh lord of the Kishu Domain.)
The fourteenth (the lord of the domain): Mochitsugu TOKUGAWA (adopted from the lord family of Saijo Domain, a branch domain of Kishu; a great-great-grandson of the seventh lord Munenobu TOKUGAWA)
The fourteenth (the lord of the domain): Mochitsugu TOKUGAWA (adopted from the lord family of Saijo Domain, a branch domain of Kishu; a great-great-grandson of the seventh lord Munenobu TOKUGAWA)

sen.j: 長福丸（早世）
sen.e: Chofuku Maru (He died prematurely.)
Chofuku Maru (died prematurely)
Chofuku Maru (died prematurely)

tit.e: The Marquis family of the Kishu Tokugawa family

sen.j: 十五代（侯爵） 徳川頼倫（田安徳川家から養子、夫人は十三代茂承の娘。）
sen.e: The fifteenth (Marquis): Yorimichi TOKUGAWA (He was an adopted child from the Tayasu Tokugawa Family; and his wife was a daughter of Iemochi TOKUGAWA, the thirteenth lord of the Kishu Domain.)
The fifteenth (a marquis): Yorimichi TOKUGAWA (adopted from the Tayasu Tokugawa Family; his wife was a daughter of the thirteenth lord Iemochi TOKUGAWA)
The fifteenth (a marquis): Yorimichi TOKUGAWA (adopted from the Tayasu Tokugawa Family; his wife was a daughter of the thirteenth lord Iemochi TOKUGAWA)

sen.j: 頼貞（十六代）
sen.e: Yorisada (the sixteenth lord of the Kishu Domain)
Yorisada (the sixteenth lord of Kishu Domain)
sen.cmt: 表現の統一のためtheを除きました。
sen.e: Yorisada (the sixteenth lord of Kishu Domain)

sen.j: 十六代（侯爵） 徳川頼貞（戦後、参議院）
sen.e: The sixteenth (Marquis): Yorisada TOKUGAWA (after the war, he became a member of the House of Councilors.)
The sixteenth (a marquis): Yorisada TOKUGAWA (after the war, a member of the House of Councilors)
The sixteenth (a marquis): Yorisada TOKUGAWA (after the war, a member of the House of Councilors)

sen.j: 頼韶（十七代、早世）
sen.e: Yoriaki (He was the seventeenth lord of the Kishu Domain but died young.)
Yoriaki (the seventeenth family head; died young)
sen.cmt: 簡潔にしました。廃藩置県により紀州藩はもう存在しないと思います。
sen.e: Yoriaki (the seventeenth family head; died young)

tit.e: The head of the Kishu Tokugawa family after the war
Kishu Tokugawa family heads after the war
Kishu Tokugawa family heads after the war

sen.j: 十七代当主 徳川頼韶（頼貞長子、早世。）
sen.e: The seventeenth head of the family: Yoriaki TOKUGAWA (he was the eldest child of Yorisada but died young.)
The seventeenth family head: Yoriaki TOKUGAWA (the eldest child of Yorisada; died young)
The seventeenth family head: Yoriaki TOKUGAWA (the eldest child of Yorisada; died young)

sen.j: 十八代当主 徳川剛 （略歴は下記に記す。）
sen.e: The eighteenth head of the family: Tsuyoshi TOKUGAWA (a brief personal record follows.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The eighteenth family head: Tsuyoshi TOKUGAWA (a son-in-law of Yorisada; the second son of Yoshitaro AOYAMA, who was said to be a second-generation Japanese-American; adopted by the widow of Yorisada, Tameko, and married the eldest daughter of Yorisada, Tomiko)
sen.cmt: この文は、本来であれば「～剛とは1965年8月に離別）」までが（）内で１文となるはずだと思いますが、（）内部が長いので、このように３文に分ければ良いと思います（あまり分割しすぎるのもよくないと思います）。
sen.e: The eighteenth head of the family: Tsuyoshi TOKUGAWA (a brief personal record follows.)
sen.cmt: Webとは異なって（略歴は下記に記す。）があるので、原文どおりとし、元の訳に戻しました。一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 頼貞娘婿。
sen.e: Tsuyoshi was an adopted son–in law of Yorisada.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Tsuyoshi was an adopted son–in law of Yorisada.
Tsuyoshi was an adopted son–in law of Yorisada.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 日系二世といわれていた青山由太郎の次男。
sen.e: Tsuyoshi was the second son of Yoshitaro AOYAMA; it was said that Yoshitaro AOYAMA was a second generation Japanese American.
Tsuyoshi was the second son of Yoshitaro AOYAMA; it was said that Yoshitaro AOYAMA was a second generation Japanese American.
Tsuyoshi was the second son of Yoshitaro AOYAMA; it was said that Yoshitaro AOYAMA was a second generation Japanese American.

sen.j: 頼貞未亡人為子の養子となり、頼貞長女宝子とみこと結婚。
sen.e: Tsuyoshi became an adopted child of Tameko, the widow of Yorisada; later he married the eldest daughter of Yorisada, Tomiko.
Tsuyoshi became an adopted child of Tameko, the widow of Yorisada; later he married the eldest daughter of Yorisada, Tomiko.
Tsuyoshi became an adopted child of Tameko, the widow of Yorisada; later he married the eldest daughter of Yorisada, Tomiko.

sen.j: 宝子は日比谷のビルの地下に「マルキーズ」（侯爵夫人）というレストランを開いたが経営に失敗。
sen.e: Tomiko opened the restaurant, "Marquis" (marchioness), located in the underground of the Hibiya building, ultimately the business failed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Tomiko opened the restaurant "Marquise" at the basement floor of a building in Hibiya, but ultimately the business failed.
sen.cmt: Marquiseが侯爵夫人を意味するので、そのまま用います。
sen.e: Tomiko opened the restaurant "Marquise" at the basement floor of a building in Hibiya, but ultimately the business failed.

sen.j: 剛とは1965年8月に離別
sen.e: Tomiko would divorce Tsuyoshi in August of 1965.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Tomiko and Tsuyoshi divorced in August 1965.
sen.cmt: 文法の誤りを直しました。
sen.e: Tomiko and Tsuyoshi divorced in August 1965.

sen.j: 十九代当主 徳川宜子
sen.e: The nineteenth head of the family: Kotoko TOKUGAWA
The nineteenth family head: Kotoko TOKUGAWA
The nineteenth family head: Kotoko TOKUGAWA
